intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion amoenanthes, commonly known as the pretty hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early autumn. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often in temperate regions of Europe. Hieracium amoenanthes is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
